article.title: Cleopatra_%28disambiguation%29
article.paragraph: wiktionaryCleopatrawiktionaryΚλεοπάτραCleopatra(inancient Egyptian language: ), is the name used in the past by many Queens ofAncient Egypt.
article.heading: People
Ancient world
Egyptian Queens

list.listitem: Cleopatra I Syra(c. 204176 BC), princess of the Seleucid Empire and by marriage, queen of Ptolemaic Egypt
Cleopatra II of Egypt(c. 185116 BC), queen (and briefly sole ruler) of Ptolemaic Egypt
Cleopatra III of Egypt(161101 BC), queen of Egypt
Cleopatra IV of Egypt(c. 138135 BC), queen of Egypt
Cleopatra V of Egypt, Egyptian Ptolemaic queen
Cleopatra VI of Egypt, Egyptian Ptolemaic queen
CleopatraCleopatra VII Philopator of Egypt(69-30 BC), last active pharaoh of Egypt before it became a Roman province and the person to whom the name most commonly refers

article.heading: Others

list.listitem: Cleopatra Eurydice of Macedon(4th century BC), wife of Philip II of Macedon
Cleopatra of Macedon(c. 356308 BC), sister of Alexander the Great, daughter of Philip II of Macedon and Olympias of Epirus
Cleopatra of Pontus(born 110 BC), wife of Tigranes the Great
Cleopatra of Jerusalem(1st century BC), wife of Herod the Great
Cleopatra Selene I(c. 135130 BC), daughter of Cleopatra III and Ptolemy VIII Physcon
Cleopatra Selene II(405 BC), daughter of Cleopatra VII and Mark Antony
Cleopatra Thea(c. 164121 BC), daughter of Cleopatra II and Ptolemy VI Philometor
Saint Cleopatra(3rd and 4th century)
Cleopatra the Alchemist(3rd or 4th century)
Berenice III of Egypt(120-80 BC), queen of Egypt sometimes known as Cleopatra Berenice

list.listitem: Cleopatra Borel(born 1979), female shot putter from Trinidad and Tobago
Cleopatra Coleman(born 1987), Australian actress
Cleopatra Mathis(born 1947), American poet and professor
Cleopatra Stratan(born 2002), Moldovan singer
Cleopatra Tucker(born 1943), American politician
Cleopatra (Greek singer)(born 1963)
